job_title: Engineer Modeling & Validation of Wind Turbine Simulation Models
company_name: Fraunhofer Institute for Wind Energy Systems (IWES)
job_responsibilities: Develop validation methods for offshore wind turbines, including research, implementation in Python, and evaluation on test benches.
Model and simulate offshore wind turbines and contribute to the further development of MoWiT models.
Be responsible for the setup (incl. design basis and design load cases) and evaluation of MoWiT simulations.
Independently generate synthetic simulation data and compare with measurement data from test benches and wind turbines.
Document findings and results in academic publications and present at conferences and trade fairs.
Assist with project acquisitions, such as background research.
job_requirements: Completed diploma or master’s degree with a focus on wind energy.
Experience in wind turbine simulation, modeling and programming (in Modelica, Python, or C).
Knowledge of offshore wind turbines, ideally including hydrodynamics and wave theories (preferred but not mandatory).
Knowledge of verification and validation methods, ideally in offshore wind energy (beneficial, not required).
Good command of German and English.
job_type: Full-time or Part-time (preferably close to full-time), Fixed-term (3 years)
skills_required: Wind turbine simulation, Modeling, Python, Modelica, C, Verification and validation methods, German, English
salary_info: Based on the public-sector collective wage agreement (TVöD), with possible performance-based variable remuneration
